notes: On 30 June, in Goma, unspecified amount of Lamuka members and others demonstrated against decision of the constitutional court on invalidation of dozens of opposition candidates. Police dispersed the demonstration using tear gas and live ammunition. Demonstrators reportedly resisted their dispersal, with some sources reporting demonstrators using rocks. One demonstrator was shot and killed by police, 1 injured and 3 arrested. The police, claimed some of the demonstrators were armed with firearms (although no reports of an armed clash). This marked first violent dispersion of a rally and first death of a demonstrator under Tshisekedi presidency. [size=no report]

The NDC-Renove remained in Loashi, while the APCLS combatants maintained control of Shoa and Buabo.

The military reported the attackers were the same group, which had attached Tshabi, Ituri.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces

actor1: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: End of March - April. Over 12,000 people were displaced in the Kibele region of northern Beni (no coordinates available). Most of the IDPs fled to Kamango and Nobili, which can only be accessed through Uganda due to the insecurity of the region in DRC. Over 60,000 people have reportedly been displaced in North Kivu, particularly the Beni territory during the month of April. Some of the displaced are crossing into Uganda through informal crossings, bypassing immigration and health officials. Humanitarian actors are concerned about the spread of Ebola and access to assistance for those crossing informally.

notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 25 February. Motorbike drivers protested in Beni following the murder of a colleague by soldiers the day prior. [size=no report]

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 25 February, in Kithevya (coordinates are approximate), ADF forces attacked the FARDC, killing 3 civilians. The military repelled the attackers.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
source: Kivu Security Tracker; UN (unspecified); Actualite; MONUSCO
notes: On 24 February, in Mamove, ADF has attacked civilians. During the attack, three civilians were killed and the health centre, houses and shops were looted and set aflame. At least 24 civilians were abducted during the attack and its aftermath. Among attackers child soldiers were spotted carrying ammunition, weapons and machetes. Most of those abducted civilians were released on 5 March.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); MSF: Doctors Without Borders; Private Security Forces (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 24 February. During the night, a suspected group of Mayi Mayi set the Ebola treatment center (operated by MSF) in Katwa, Butembo on fire. One security guard died while trying to escape. A note found at the scene threatened further attacks until elections are held in the region and alleged election fraud on the part of Tshisekedi.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 24 February. Two soldiers shot and killed a motorbike driver in Mangboko, Beni as he was taking them from Beni to Mbau.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); CRDRC: Congolese Red Cross
notes: 24 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a Red Cross employee in Mamove, Oicha. The assailants forced the abductee to wear his red cross uniform. Unclear link with ADF attack on Mamove on the same day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 24 February 2019. During the night, an unidentified armed group attempted to raid a home in the Kyeshero neighborhood of Goma. A police officer repelled the assailants but was injured during the clash.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 23 February. A soldier raped a woman in Ngora, Walikale.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 22 February 2019. The Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked the FARDC in Kikere, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The FARDC shot and killed a civilian, who they mistook for a combatant.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
assoc_actor_2: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura); APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)
notes: 21 February. The NDC-Renove clashed with the APCLS and a coalition of Nyatura groups led by Kavumbi in and around Katoko, Bashali (no coordinates available). Four civilians, three NDC-R combatants and four from the APCLS/Nyatura coalition were killed. Mapenzi, the leader of Ndimendime was also injured. Three women were abducted by the NDC-R, along with two Nyatura combatants. Two children were also reported missing since the clashes.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 February. Students from schools in the Ndosho area of Goma, protested in the city against insecurity in the area. The protests came the day after an attack on the area. [size=no report]

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 February. During the evening, unidentified armed men attacked Ndosho. The perpetrators killed three people during the attack and abducted 11 others. At least one body, some sources indicate three, of the abductees were later found.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 21 February. A police officer shot and killed another officer and a detainee in Busumba, Masisi. The assailant then killed himself.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a man from Kambake, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The perpetrators demanded a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 February. The FARDC attacked Mayi Mayi PRM forces during operations in the Vurondo-Museya area, as part of larger operations in Lubero (Vurondo and Museya are located along the border between Beni and Lubero). Two militia members were killed, some sources reported four fatalities.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 20 February. The FARDC launched an attack on Mayi Mayi forces along the Karuruma-Kyavinyonge road in Virunga National Park. Three Mayi Mayi were killed and two were captured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 February. An unidentified armed group killed three people in Bugamba, near Goma. The assailants also abducted civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 19 February. The FARDC captured an ADF fighter in Gawa, Beni. They also seized a machine gun.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 19 February. The NDC-Renove attacked the FARDC, as they were attempting to establish a base in Kyuto, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The NDC-R forced the FARDC to retreat from the town. Five soldiers were killed and one militia member was wounded.

actor1: APCLS-M: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo (Mapenzi)
assoc_actor_2: Loashi Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 19 February. The APCLS-Mapenzi tortured the Loashi village chief, who died from his injuries.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 18 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a nurse from his home in Ishango. His body was later discovered in Graben - inside the Virunga National Park, which many armed groups operate out of. The murder prompted a strike of health workers in the Vuhovi zone over insecurity.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 18 February. ADF forces attacked Mavivi. The FARDC responded and the groups clashed for two hours. Two civilians were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 18 February, in Ngite, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 2, injuring 1 and abducting 1.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 17 February. The FARDC killed two Mayi Mayi combatants and destroyed Mayi Mayi camps in the Beni territory. Four militia members were captured.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Mazembe)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019); MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 17 February. Mayi Mayi Mazembe attacked a CENI warehouse and a residence owned by Kabila in Beni (unclear if in Beni town or territory). Police, military, and MONUSCO forces repelled the attackers.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 16 February. NDC-Renove forces attacked the Mayi Mayi Kavumbi in Lwama, Masisi in an effort to gain control of the town.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 16 February. NDC-Renove forces attacked the Nyatura Jean Marie, between Lukweti and Nyange Bibwe, in Masisi.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 February. An unidentified armed group attacked the Mugunga and Majengo neighborhoods of Goma. The attackers killed six civilians. A military uniform was later discovered near Virunga National Park where the assailants fled after the attack.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 16 February. An unidentified armed group (believed to be the same group which attacked Goma town) killed two civilians in the Nyiragongo territory. After the attacks the group reportedly fled into Virunga National Park.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 16 February, in Masilikwede (near Kamango), the ADF clashed with FARDC. 5 soldiers were killed and 3 were injured.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 15 February. The NDC-Renove clashed with APCLS and Nyatura-Jean Marie forces in Hembe, Masisi (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map). Five combatants were killed and six people were wounded, including three civilians.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. Angry residents attacked a hand washing station - a part of the Ebola response - in Mambasa, Ituri. The residents opposed the Ebola vaccination campaign and were angry that locals were not hired as part of the response. Soldiers and police responded by firing into the air to disperse the group. A woman was injured by a stray bullet.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Residents of Masisi and Nyabiondo protested calling for the restoration of security in the region and the resumption of medical services by MSF - who suspended activities in the region after staff members were temporarily abducted.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 15 February. Artisanal miners protested in Rubaya and Gakombe (no coordinates available) against a reduction in their salaries.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 15 February. The FARDC killed two ADF leaders - Kibuye Kajuju (aka Kadjadju and Canada) and Richard Mugisa (aka MTM)- in Mamove, Oicha.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 14 February. Residents of Rwangoma and LUCHA members protested, calling for increased security and the release of those abducted during the 07/02 attacks on the town.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 14 February. Police officers in Beni shot into the air in protest of their salary payments, which was less than they had expected. Those responsible were arrested.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 14 February, in Oicha, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC. 1 soldier has been injured and 1 civilian killed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 13 February. ADF combatants killed three civilians traveling to Mamove, on the Oicha-Mamove road.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 13 February, in Mulolya, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 2. 1 civilian was reported missing.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 12 February. A soldier killed a civilian in Kibongo (no coordinates available), near Nyamilima, after the civilian refused to transport the soldier's belongings.

actor1: Civilians (South Sudan)
notes: 12 February (on or before). Over the course of a few days, approximately 5,000 refugees fleeing violence in South Sudan crossed into Congolese villages along the border, near Ingbokolo.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 12 February. An unidentified armed group attacked national park guards in Museya, Beni. The guards, along with the FARDC, repelled the attackers, killing two.

actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 11 February. Three FARDC soldiers were killed in Mataba, Beni by suspected UPLC combatants.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 11 February. The ADF attacked an FARDC position in Mamove, Beni. The rebels also looted the town and attempted to abduct civilians. Local civil society organizations report four rebels killed and four abductees freed. The military reported a dozen rebel fatalities (coded at lowest estimate).

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. Local residents in Mavono, Butembo set fire to the Ebola health center in the town. Reasons unclear.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: 11 February. FDLR-RUD combatants abducted a man from Mirumba, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 11 February. An unidentified armed group attacked the FARDC in Ndombi, Oicha.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 11 February, in Mayimoya, unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 1 soldier.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. Unidentified armed men abducted a man near Bunyangula, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The abductee was on his way to pay a ransom for other hostages. The assailants demanded a ransom for the abductee.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. A soldier was killed by an unidentified armed group in Vusalali (no coordinates available), in the Bashu region.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
notes: 10 February. Nyatura combatants clashed with the NDC-Renove in Nyampanika and Kashanje (no coordinates available for either village, coded as one event at Mokoto prec2), in the Bashali region.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 10 February (on or around). An unidentified armed group ambushed MONUSCO and FARDC forces along the Beni-Butembo road.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. An unidentified armed group attacked two soldiers at a checkpoint in Busalali, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map) killing one of the soldiers and injuring the other.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 10 February. An unidentified armed group attacked a FARDC base in Kiteraga, Oicha. The assailants set fire to the military site and injured one soldier.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 09 February (on or around). During the weekend, FARDC forces destroyed a rebel training center in the Wango forest, near Largu. The attack was part of an operation against the group operating in the Djugu territory. Six rebels were killed during the three hours of clashes.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 9 Feb 2019, an FARDC soldier killed a woman with a machete in Lyakobo neighborhood of Beni town. The FARDC soldier attempted to rape the victim who resisted.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group abducted two MSF employees from Bitoy (no coordinates available near Masisi town). The assailants released the abductees later that evening.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: 08 February. FDLR FOCA forces attacked the FARDC in Tabi (no coordinates available, in the Burungu region) Masisi territory, killing three soldiers.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. The FARDC clashed with an armed group in Nyolo (no coordinates available), in the Djugu territory. The armed group has been utilizing the town as a base for launching attacks in the territory.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
assoc_actor_2: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. Suspected ADF combatants killed three pygmies in Mavivi, Oicha.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: 08 February. MONUSCO launched an offensive against the ADF in the Mayangose Forest (no coordinates available) in Beni.

actor1: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 08 February. The FDLR-FOCA attacked a FARDC site at Itabi (no coordinate available, located in Masisi). The attackers beheaded two soldiers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. A woman was shot and killed by unidentified perpetrators in Urii, Mahagi (no coordinates available, 19 km from Mahagi town). The assailants also removed the woman's genitals. Her body was discovered the following day. Local residents believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 08 February. An unidentified armed group attacked Mundiba. The group killed one elderly man and injured his wife. The perpetrators also set four houses on fire.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 8 February, at PK 9 road near Mbau, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 2 and injuring 3 soldiers (no further details available).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 8 February, in Kudukudu, ADF attacked civilians, killing 4, including a child and injuring 2.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
source: Radio Moto; Radio Okapi; Kivu Security Tracker; UN (unspecified)
notes: On 7 February, in Rwangoma, an unidentified armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked civilians, killing 6, injuring 2, abducting 8, including 6 children. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. The body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. ADF combatants attacked the FARDC in the Mbua Kamango region.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. A group of Mayi Mayi set fire to a FARDC site in Buzumba (no coordinates available), Masisi.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 07 February. LUCHA members demonstrated in Goma against a barrier at the port. Police intervened and arrested seven demonstrators.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 February (on or around). The corpse of a woman was found in Ariwara, Ituri. The victim's genitals had been removed. Some locals believe the genitals were removed for ritualistic purposes.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 07 February (on or before). An armed group (likely the ADF due to the presence of children and women within the armed group) attacked Rwangoma. The FARDC reportedly repelled the attackers (clash coded separately) but residents reported hearing gunfire into the next morning. At least four civilian fatalities were reported (other sources indicated seven). The attackers also looted civilian property and abducted four adults and four children - the body of one of the abductees was found near Bwerera a few days later.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February (on or before). A soldier was attacked with machetes by an unidentified group in Rwangoma.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February. Residents of Goma demonstrated after a police officer killed a teenager the prior night. The demonstrators set fire to the police station in Keshero, where the incident had occurred.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 05 February. FARDC forces attacked three Mayi Mayi Charles combatants in Buramba, Rutshuru. One Mayi Mayi member was killed and weapons were seized.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 05 February. The UPLC attacked the Kasitu (no coordinates available) health center in the Vuhovi area. The attackers burned the mattresses in the center.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 04 February. Residents of the Keshero neighborhood of Goma caught a robber and police intervened to prevent the mob from attacking the robber. One police officer opened fire on the crowd of locals trying to disperse the mob, killing a teenage girl and injuring two male youths.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 04 February. An unidentified armed group abducted a man in Kiriva, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants killed the abductee.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 4 February, in Mapobu (aka Kisiki), an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, killing 6 and injuring 2 soldiers (no further details available).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Charles)
notes: 03 February. Members of the Mayi Mayi Charles clashed amongst themselves near Kamuhororo, Rutshuru. Eight members were killed, including Charles Bokande, the leader of the group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 03 February (on or before). An unidentified armed group killed a soldier in Rwangoma, Beni. The body was discovered in a bush.

notes: 02 February. During the night, the FARDC clashed with an armed group which attacked Torges (no coordinates available, located 25 km from Blukwa, in the Bahema chieftaincy of Djugu). At least, six assailants and two soldiers were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 February. An armed group attacked Torges (no coordinates available, 25 km from Blukwa). The assailants looted the village, abducted four civilians and killed two others.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 02 - 03 February. An armed group abducted 14 farmers in Kashwa, Rutshuru, including 12 women. FARDC forces responded to the attack and exchanged fire with the assailants as they fled (coded in separate event).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. The FARDC attacked Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kanyatsi, Lubero. Two soldiers and one militia member were killed during the clashes.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. The ADF attacked the FARDC in the Boikene neighborhood of Beni. The FARDC repelled the attack. One soldier was killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 02 February. Following clashes against the Mayi Mayi Mazembe, the FARDC looted civilian property in Kanyatsi, Lubero. The soldiers also raped a girl.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 02 February. UPLC combatants opened fire on a home in Kitokolu, Beni (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). Two men were killed and one was injured.

notes: On 2 February, in Kasinga, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians (no further details available).

actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 February. An unidentified armed group stabbed a soldier in Musienene, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants stole the soldier's weapon.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: First half of February. The NDC-Renove imposed taxes and subjected civilians to forced labor in the towns of Luibo and Lukweti, Masisi - which the group occupies.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 31 January. The FARDC attacked UPLC bases in Pabuka and Kalingathi. Approximately 20 rebels and two soldiers were killed in the operation (coded as 11 fatalities per location). Weapons were also seized.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
notes: 31 January. The FARDC attacked UPLC bases in Pabuka and Kalingathi (no coordinates available; located south-east of Beni town). Approximately 20 rebels and two soldiers were killed in the operation (coded as 11 fatalities per location). Weapons were also seized.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Niyonzimana Faction
notes: 31 January. The Nyatura FDP (Niyonzimana Faction) abducted and tortured six men from their fields near Burambo, Rutshuru (coordinates are approximate based on OCHA map). The victims were targeted after they failed to pay a fee to the militia. One of the men died from his injuries.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 31 January. The FARDC attacked an APCLS site in Buabo, Masisi (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The APCLS repelled the military forces back to Masisi center. A child was injured during the clashes.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 30 January. The FARDC clashed with APCLS forces in Kalihe and Lwanguba (no coordinates available; both villages are located in Masisi).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 30 January. A military site in Kahira was attacked by a Nyatura group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. An unidentified group abducted seven people from Kalengera. Three escaped, while the perpetrators are demanding a ransom for the others.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 29 January. NDC-Renove fighters clashed with Nyatura Nzayi in Lwama, in Bashali. Four Nzayi members, three NDC-R members and three civilians were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 29 January. The APCLS clashed with Bohoza's Nyatura fighters in Mipfungulu and Kise (no coordinates available for either location) in the Masisi territory. Four Bohoza fighters and two APCLS fighters were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Rioters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 29 January. Angry residents in Mubambiro burned military barracks to protest harassment by soldiers and insecurity.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura-Kavumbi); Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 28 January - 02 April: The FARDC launched operations against the Mayi Mayi Simba in the Babila Babombi and Bombo communes of Mambasa territory. 38 Mayi Mayi Simba were killed during the period. 12 are coded in Mapendano on 01/03. The remaining 26 fatalities are spread between 8 events during the time period (one battle per week).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 28 January. An unidentified armed group robbed an ambulance and abducted the driver from the Lubero General Hospital, near Itolero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker Map). The assailants demanded a $5,000 ransom.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 28 January, at PK 18 road near Mbau, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 2.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 28 January, at PK 19 road near Mbau, an unidentified armed group attacked civilians, killing 1.

notes: 27 January. An unidentified armed group abducted six people in Mubambiro, including two ICRC employees. The perpetrators also killed an infant, while they abducted the mother.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 25-26 January. Two-day clashes between APCLS and NDC-Renove in Shimbisha (no coordinates available; near Lukweti). Three NDC-Renove fighters, one APCLS fighter, and one civilian were killed (fatalities spread across two events).

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia
notes: 26 January. Mayi Mayi raped three women in Kwebo (no coordinates available; located in the Masisi territory).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

notes: 25-26 January. Two-day clashes between APCLS and NDC-Renove in Shimbisha (no coordinates available; near Lukweti). Three NDC-Renove fighters, one APCLS fighter, and one civilian were killed (fatalities spread across two events).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 25 January. An unidentified armed group abducted a man from Muhani (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The assailants demanded a $700 ransom.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Niyonzimana Faction
notes: 25 January. Nyatura Niyonzimana abducted one man from Karambi and looted his home.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 24 January. NDC-Renove forces clashed with the Nyatura Nzayi in Nyabura (no coordinates available; located in the Bahali-Mokoto district).

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 24 January (on or before). ADF forces ambushed drivers on RN 4, in Kisiki-Mayimoya. Three people were killed, two were injured. Three Okapi vehicles were also intercepted but the drivers were not harmed.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: 24 January. The ADF ambushed an Okapi Logistics, NGO convoy near Kisiki. The assailants killed three and injured three during the robbery.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 24 January, in Mayimoya, an unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, injuring 1 soldier. Additionally 3 civilians were killed and 3 injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 26 January, in Malolu, unidentified armed group attacked civilians, injuring 1.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
notes: 23 January. Charles Kakule's militia abducted 30 fishermen on Lake Edward. Some of the abductees managed to escape, while the others were released following ransom payments.

actor1: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The UPLC abducted three members of MONUSCO in Kisalala. Shortly after the abduction, the FARDC freed the abductees.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 23 January. The military arrested Kamate Mungumwa and Muhindo Mbiriki, two leaders of the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kirumba. The leaders were unarmed at the time of arrest.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 23 January. An unidentified armed group raided home and abducted a man in Mbuhi-Pilote.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Raia Mutomboki-Ngandu)
notes: 23 January. The Raia Mutomboki Mungoro clashed with the Raia Mutomboki Ngandu after the Ngandu group looted a cow and goats from Nguku, Walikale (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map). The Mungoro combatants recovered the stolen livestock.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 23 January, in Kididiwe, unidentified armed group attacked civilians, injuring 1. 1 civilian was reported missing.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kakule)
notes: 22 January. Kakule's militia abducted 39 fishermen (other sources indicated 20) on Lake Edward.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with an armed group in Largu. The military reported three soldiers and five rebel fatalities. However, civil society has reported four military fatalities. Civil society reported the group looted arms from a military depot in town but the FARDC denied the report.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 22 January. The FARDC clashed with the Simba militia in Dembele (coordinates are approximate based on reports that the village is 15-17 km from Nia Nia, along the Kisangani road). The groups leaders, Manu and Abley, were killed along with five other members of the militia.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Bohoza Faction
actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: 22 January. The Nyatura Bohoza faction clashed with the APCLS in Nyabyara and Luala (no coordinates available), near Kahira in Masisi. Four civilians and seven fighters were killed during the clashes.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 01 - 31 January. During the month of January, 44 people from the Kiwanja area were kidnapped, including 11 children. The abductions are carried out by armed groups and criminals who seek ransoms. Most of the abductions target women. Coded as one VAC event each week of January.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 22 Jan 2019, a policeman shot and killed a woman in Butare village of Masisi territory.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 21 January, in Mapobu, the  ADF attacked and killed 25 FARDC soldiers and injured 22 other. Additionally 5 soldiers were reported missing. The UN Group of Experts collected evidence that corroborated this information. During the same period, several sources witnessed a high number of injured ADF combatants brought back to ADF camps, indicating their involvement in attacks and clashes. FARDC seized a type 80 general purpose machine gun from an ADF combatant.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
assoc_actor_2: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group shot at an Oxfam vehicle in Rutobogo (coordinates are approximate, based on location 2 km west of Sake) and raped two women. The driver escaped. The armed group then ambushed a motorbike, killing two riders, while one managed to escape. Locals indicated that this group is also responsible for abductions in the area but provided no further details.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 21-22 January. Five civilians died during clashes in and around Luke between the FARDC and Nyatura Kasongo. Fatalities spread across two events.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
notes: 09-23 January (on or around). FARDC led two weeks of military operations against FDLR bases in North-Kivu, regaining key posts such as the FDLR base in Faringa, Bwito (Rutshuru). After Faringa was captured, fighting continued in Rubaya of Masisi as the FDLR fighters tried to retreat to Sud-Kivu. 10 fatalities during operations. Coded as two events per week, two in Faringa, two in Rubaya, with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An armed group (suspected to be the same that carried out attacks in Rutobogo earlier on the same day), attacked Kimoka during the night. The perpetrators raped two women, killed another, and wounded three men.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 21 January. An unidentified group abducted two men from the Benengule neighborhood of Beni. The assailants tortured one of the abductees before releasing him. The man died of his injuries.

actor1: NDC-G: Nduma Defence of Congo (Guidon)
notes: On 21 Jan 2019, the NDC Guidon attacked a Nyatura Nzayi position in Munongo village of Masisi territory. NDC Guidon militants chased Nyatura Nzayi fighters from their position. A man drowned during their escape.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: 01-31 January 2019. During the month of January, FRPI, who were in the midst of peace negotiations, looted at least three villages in the Aveba and Geti areas. The assailants raped a 15 year-old girl during one of the attacks. Coded as three events at random points in January - two looting and one violence against civilians.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 20 January. Clashes between the NDC-Renove and Nyatura-Nzayi continued in Munongo Kakonse (no coordinates available, in the Mokoto district). Six people were killed including two civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: 20 January (on or around). The FARDC and Eco Guards clashed with the Kakule militia, securing the release of 39 hostages being held by the group.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 January. An unidentified armed group attacked a minibus near Kayna, Lubero (coordinates are approximate based on Kivu Security Tracker map), abducting five passengers and robbing them. They demanded a ransom.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)
notes: 20 January. NDC-Renove forces clashed with Nyatura-Nzayi in Kinyana, Masisi (no coordinates available). Five Nzayi combatants, one NDC-R fighter, and four civilians were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 20 January. Unidentified armed men killed two men and robbed a home in Kitchanga.

actor1: NDC-R: Nduma Defence of Congo (Renewal)

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: On 18 January, in Kivuye, around 4000 CNRD members including 400 combatants left the group's stronghold and moved south towards South Kivu Province. The movement has been caused by growing number of attacks directed at the group.

actor1: Walendu Pitsi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 17 January (on or around). 20 villages in the Ngakpa and Uketa (no coordinates available) areas of Djugu were looted and burned by a neighboring group from the Walendu Pitsi community. Over 1,500 homes in the area were destroyed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 17 January, in Semuliki (no coordinates available, along the Mbau-Kamango road), an unidentified armed group attacked civilians (no further details available).

notes: 07 January. Two armed men abducted a Ugandan man from Munyaga, while he was tending to his field located in the DRC (Location coded as Nyamilima with precision of 3 as it is the DRC town closest to Munyaga).

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 07 January (on or before). Additional police forces were deployed throughout Goma after the announcement of the presidential election winner was postponed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 07 January. During the night, a girl was tortured and raped in the Bankoko neighborhood of Bunia. She died the following day. Some locals attribute this crime to the release of militant prisoners at the end of December.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: On 6 January, at PK 20 road near Mbau, unidentified armed group clashed with FARDC, injuring 1.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: 05 January. Police arbitrarily arrested 79 people in Goma, who were celebrating the rumored victory of Martin Fayulu.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 May 2019. An FARDC patrol clashed with the ADF near Bovata, Oicha. According to local civil society, the military repelled the group into Virunga Forest. The FARDC recovered AK-47s and PKMs. Military sources reported that on 03/05 , an FARDC patrol found the bodies of two men who are suspected of being captured by the ADF during the attack on Bovata, and later killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
notes: 01 May 2019. After being ambushed by the FDLR earlier in the day, FARDC forces attacked the civilian population in Rugari. Six civilians, including three women, were killed in the retaliatory attack. The military denied the attacked but accused the local population of cooperating with the FDLR.

notes: 01 January - 28 March. The NDC-R, Nyatura Kibumba, and Nyatura Bohoza raped separately at least 57 women in the Bashali-Mokoto territory, leaving three killed. Two attacks occurred on 14/01. The remaining attacks were coded as one event per week over the mentioned period (12 events). Women were most frequently attacked by combatants while tending to their fields. A number of armed groups are vying for control of the territory.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: 30 December. Voter intimidation during the voting for the presidential elections reported in various areas of North-Kivu. Security forces interfered with voting at some polling locations in Mulimbi and Butare (Rutshuru) and Mutongo (Walikale). Armed groups also interfered: the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua for Shadary in Walikale territory; NDC and Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kasiki, Bunyatenge, Kinyatsi, and Mbwavinywa (Lubero); NDC-Guidon and APCLS Mapenzi for Shadary at polls in Mwendabandu ((Bukombo, Lwibo, Lushebere, Ngesha, Bugoye, Bushore, Bonde villages)) (Masisi territory). Meanwhile, Nyatura-FDLR coalition and Nyatura-Domi for Fayulu in polling sites in the Bwito region (Rutshuru).

notes: 27 December. Demonstrations led by LUCHA continued in Beni against the postponement of elections in the region. The demonstrators burned tires and ransacked a Ebola facility, causing the patients to flee. The home of a police officer was also set on fire. Security forces fired to disperse the rioters. One demonstrator was killed, three police were injured, four LUCHA members were injured and 17 rioters were arrested.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

notes: On 14 November 2018, in Kididiwe, joint FARDC-MONUSCO troops recaptured a former FARDC camp from ADF militiamen. During the operation, 7 United Nations peacekeepers were killed and 10 wounded, while 2 were still missing in action. FARDC reported that 14  soldiers had been killed, 29 had been wounded and 12 were still missing in action. An estimated 40 to 50 ADF combatants were killed.

The police used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On May 20, presumed ADF rebels attacked Mbau northeast of Beni. 9 civilians were killed during the attack and 2 injured. Radio Okapi and AFP mention that casualties were 10, later confirmed by the army and civil society. The attack started at 18h30, with rebels burning a vehicle, pillaging stores and businesses, and killing civilians who inhabited the location. The military eventually intervened and the clash lasted for 3h, with the FARDC managing in the end to repel them (coded in a separate battle event). The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: Non-violent activity: On May 19, the police prevented a meeting from the "Ensemble pour le changement" electoral coalition led by opposition candidate Moise Katumbi in Bunia. The police deployed to several locations in Bunia, in order to prevent even journalists from accessing the hotel where the meeting was due to take place.

actor2: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On 27 April, thousands of Congolese women marched in Beni town against the ongoing insecurity and massacres in the country. Police escorted the women during the march.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: On April 26, the FDLR-FOCA attacked the FARDC in Katale, seeking revenge for the destruction of their their charcoal kiln.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: On April 26, the FRPI ambushed a vehicle carrying policemen in Boga. It is unclear if there was an exchange of fire. The assailants stole the policemen's property and fled to Kabona.

actor1: Protesters (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 26 April, women in Beni town held a sit-in in front of the Mayor's office to denounce the ongoing insecurity and massacres in the country. A protest march was organised the following day.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 26, unidentified armed men killed a 40-year old man in Kibenete village, Rutshuru, when he was returning from the Kikuku market.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On April 25, tensions escalated in Kpandroma in Djugu during a livelihood distribution as displaced people protested unfair distribution and began pillaging goods; the police forces fired shots to disperse the rioters. Two killed - a baby who fell from the back of his mother while she was stealing goods and was stomped on by the crowds; another from the police gunshots.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On April 25, LUCHA protesters organised a peaceful march in Beni against insecurity in the country. Hundreds of people attended, included the community from the Bel Air de Ruwenzori quartier, the most affected by massacres and insecurity. The protesters were dispersed by police who resorted to tear gas at roundabout Nyamwisi. Police arrested 42 LUCHA supporters and released them the same evening.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 25, unidentified armed men kidnapped a man from Rutsiro village, Rutshuru, and demanded a ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On April 22, a soldier killed another soldier in the Boikene neighbourhood of Beni. One soldier had misbehaved, and the FARDC deployed a platoon to address the issue. The platoon commander tried to reprimand him, but was shot and died.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On the weekend of April 21-22, "rebels" attacked the FARDC positions in Langbe. There was exchange of shots.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
actor2: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: Non-violent activity: On April 22, CNRD rebels chased three policemen out of Katsiru after considering them personae non gratae. The policemen fled to Kitchanga. Despite the presence of the FARDC on Katsiru, the CNRD have a base 2km away, and can exert their influence, often coming to the city to extort habitants.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 22, armed men raided the locality of Kau, in Djugu, and kidnapped 8 people. They first attacked the village of Dolo, where a 30 year old man was injured, and then proceeded to kidnap civilians in Kau.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: "Two unarmed security guards at an INGO compound were administered an unknown drug in order to incapacitate them and facilitate a break-in into three different INGO offices on the compound. The perpetrators stole vehicles and laptops. Both of the security guards required medical attention."

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
notes: On 20 April, ADF gunmen killed a motorcycle driver and his client close to Tungudu village in Beni territory. They were on their way to Ndalya market in Ituri. The FARDC chased and attacked the ADF forces right after the attack, killing one ADF.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
notes: On April 20, the FARDC clashed with the ADF on the Beni-Kasindi axis, 15km north-east of Beni. Six fatalities in total in two separate attacks outside Beni on that day. These attacks come as a way of discrediting the FARDC owing to the recent recaptures of territory in the 'triangle of death' in between Mbau-Kamango and Eringeti, in Beni. The ADF is moving in small satellite groups around the region, launching attacks were possible, in order to counter the FARDC.

actor1: Beni Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 20 April, unknown gunmen shot and killed two men close to Kasitu village in Beni territory. The assailants stole the victims' motorcycle. On the same day, unknown gunmen also killed another civilian in Beni territory (Mangolikene village) while he was returning from his field.

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On 20 April, ADF gunmen killed a motorcycle driver and his client close to Tungudu village in Beni territory. They were on their way to Ndalya market in Ituri. The FARDC chased and attacked the ADF forces right after the attack, killing one ADF.

actor1: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) Love Faction
notes: On 19 April, Nyatura love militants broke into the house of the Chumba local customary chief in Rutshuru territory. They shot him dead along with two other members of his family.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo

The police tried to disperse the crowd during their walk to the cabinet of the province's governor, but did not manage. During the struggle between them, the police used tear gas to disperse them, and was aided by the military. Some students were received in the cabinet of the governor.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

It was the customary chief of Bashali Kaembe - Mwami Kaembe - that alerted the FARDC to the existence of these weapons.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Eco-Guards
notes: On April 9, five rangers and a driver were killed in an ambush in Virunga National Park by suspected Charles militia. One other ranger was also injured. This attack comes one week after another park ranger was killed in the same location.

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

Three rebels captured, among which the commander Kambale Mboka Eric. According to FARDC captain capitaine Mak Hazukay, the Mazembe are teaming up with the ADF to take back Mwalika.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: ADF: Allied Democratic Forces
notes: On March 27, at night, the ADF attacked Buhili, in the Rwenzori commune, Beni, taking three civilians hostage. After the attack, the ADF were intercepted by the FARDC. The clash lasted for 30 minutes, after which 10 civilians, including the 3 hostages, were killed.

notes: On March 26, LUCHA militants took to the streets to protest in front of the MONUSCO offices in Goma, before police fired teargas to disperse them. 5 protesters were injured as they forced their way into the MONUSCO offices while the police was firing teargas; a police officer was also injured when he tried to fire teargas. The protesters in case wanted to leave the memorandum, which asked the UN Security Council to vote for a new resolution for its mandate in DRC, vouching to guarantee free and peaceful elections.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019)
assoc_actor_2: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 15 March, the head of the police in Mudzi Pela, Bunia, was killed in an IDP camp by revolting IDPs. The police officer went to the rescue of provincial minister Didi Angaika, who had been taken hostage by the IDPs in the camp, during his visit accompanied by the National Institute of Professional Preparation. The minister and some others in his delegation were taken hostages, and when the police intervened, they used tear gas and shots in the air to disperse the crowd. The head of the police was nonetheless hit by a stone in the head, falling dead just after.

The violence has prompted significant population displacements within the province and towards neighbouring Uganda.
